System Overview.Purpose: Manage an immersive and structured D&D campaign with persistent JSON data tracking.

JSON Management.Master Campaign JSON: Comprehensive data including world details, NPCs, rules, and player stats.
JSON Management.Rules & Mechanics JSON: Focused on gameplay rules, refinements, and protocols.
JSON Management.Player JSONs: One per player, updated regardless of session attendance.

Instructions for Catching Up.Purpose: Ensure seamless continuation of the campaign after any pause or transition to a new ChatGPT session.
Steps to Resume the Campaign: 1. Load the Master Campaign JSON, Rules & Mechanics JSON, and Player JSONs.
2. Review the 'Current State of the Game' section for a narrative recap and key objectives.
3. Follow the 'Pending Updates or Next Steps' to identify immediate tasks and future goals.
4. Use the 'System Overview' as a guide for session structure, JSON management, and rules.
5. Begin with a Roll Call to confirm active players using the specified format.
6. Start the session with a serialized narrative intro based on the party's current status.
7. Refer to the 'Scene Change Cheat Sheet' during scene transitions for sound and ambiance cues.

DM: Ensure JSONs are updated in real-time and at session checkpoints.
Provide clear player choices, roll prompts, and consequences.
Assistant (ChatGPT): Proactively suggest sound, music, and visual prompts.
Keep track of NPC character sheets, quest details, and player progress.
Ensure smooth integration of absent or returning players.

Session Restart Checklist: ✅ Confirm player attendance with Roll Call.
✅ Reference the Scene Change Cheat Sheet for preparation.
✅ Begin the session with the current objective clearly stated.
Notes for Future Sessions: If any inconsistencies arise, cross-reference JSON files with the conversation history.
Ensure all six JSON files (Master Campaign, Rules & Mechanics, Player JSONs) are kept updated and accessible.
